trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration integration with SugarCRM | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration integration with SugarCRM | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use SugarCRM with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use SugarCRM with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Sugar CRM.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Sugar CRM.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Sugar CRM single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Sugar CRM single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Sugar CRM will be able to single sign into the application at your Sugar CRM company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Sugar CRM will be able to single sign into the application at your Sugar CRM company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Sugar CRM
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Sugar CRM

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Sugar CRM.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Sugar CRM.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Sugar CRM.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Sugar CRM.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Sugar CRM, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Sugar CRM, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sugar CRM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sugar CRM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Sugar CRM with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Sugar CRM with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Sugar CRM tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Sugar CRM tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Sugar CRM application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Sugar CRM application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Sugar CRM page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Sugar CRM page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sugar CRM Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your Sugar CRM application (e.g.: "http://company.sugarondemand.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sugar CRM Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your Sugar CRM application (e.g.: "http://company.sugarondemand.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Sugar CRM company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Sugar CRM company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Administration section, click Password Management.
trans-unit.target: In the Administration section, click Password Management.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML Authentication.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Authentication section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Authentication section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SLO URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SLO URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into X.509 Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into X.509 Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sugar CRM dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Sugar CRM, they must be provisioned to Sugar CRM.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Sugar CRM, they must be provisioned to Sugar CRM.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Sugar CRM, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Sugar CRM, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Sugar CRM company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Sugar CRM company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Administration section, click User Management.
trans-unit.target: In the Administration section, click User Management.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Users \> Create New User.
trans-unit.target: Go to Users \> Create New User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the User Profile tab, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the User Profile tab, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the user name, last name and email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the user name, last name and email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: As Status, select Active.
trans-unit.target: As Status, select Active.

trans-unit.source: On the Password tab, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Password tab, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the password into the related textbox.
trans-unit.target: Type the password into the related textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Sugar CRM user account creation tools or APIs provided by Sugar CRM to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Sugar CRM user account creation tools or APIs provided by Sugar CRM to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Sugar CRM application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Sugar CRM application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
